newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: PRESS DIGEST - SOUTH AFRICA - SEPT 4.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - SOUTH AFRICA - SEPT 4.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the South African press on Wednesday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- South African fuel prices are likely to rise in early October after the U.S. strike against Iraq put pressure on oil prices.
- Grinaker Holdings overcame competitive pressures to post a 24 percent increase in earnings before exceptionals in the year to June.
- The Automobile Manufacturers Employers' Organisation, the National Union of Metalworkers of SA and the SA Workers' Union on Tuesday signed an agreement for a 8.5 percent wage increase.
- Randgold and Exploration Co Ltd has consoldiated its West African foothold by buying BHP Holdings Inc's Mali operations, including control of the Syama gold mine.
- Standard Bank Corp signed a 10-year agreement worth more than one billion rand with EDS to outsource a large portion of its card division activities in the biggest deal of its kind in South Africa.
- Fraud at petrol pumps in South Africa could be worth a hefty 3.5 billion rand a year and ranks second to armed robbery in terms of serious economic crime.
- A South African National Defence Force member was among four people arrested on Tuesday in connection with the murder of former footballer Eliakim "Pro" Khumalo during a car hijacking.
